note.p: Birth: Oxford Street, Newcastle upon Tyne, Northumberland, England (07 August 1841)
Death: His house, 63 Eaton Rise, Ealing, Middlesex (02 June 1903)

Education: Career: Entered his uncle's firm, Matthew Hall and Co, sanitary engineers; photographed stars. After his uncle's death in 1878 he took over the company and manged it until his retirement in 1890. involved with Ealing firm of Ottaway & Co. in developing improved optical gunsights for the British army and navy.
Memberships: FRAS; president of the astronomy section of the British Association for the Advancement of Science. 1900-1903; awarded an honorary LLD from University of St Andrews in 1891;
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1905 vol 75 pp 313-318 signed by H H T
